content:
• Monday, September 26, 2011
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) acquires online video site 56.com, a leading user generated content online...

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) acquires online video site 56.com, a leading user generated content online video sharing site in China, for $80M in cash. The deal is expected to close in Q4. RENN +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) cuts Q2 guidance, now seeing revenue in the range of...

    Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) cuts Q2 guidance, now seeing revenue in the range of $138M - $141M, down from previous $147M - $153M estimates and below analysts' consensus of $149M. Shares -5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • KEYW

    Shares of KEYW Holding (NASDAQ:KEYW) plunge 19% AH after the firm announces a competitor won a...

    Shares of KEYW Holding (NASDAQ:KEYW) plunge 19% AH after the firm announces a competitor won a systems integration contact from the Air Force.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • NVE

    NV Energy (NVE +3.9%) finished the day with solid gains after Goldman upped the stock earlier...

    NV Energy (NVE +3.9%) finished the day with solid gains after Goldman upped the stock earlier today to buy, citing the company's above average earnings growth and improved cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • UTX

    United Technologies (UTX +3.8%) posts a solid gain today after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock...

    United Technologies (UTX +3.8%) posts a solid gain today after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to "overweight" earlier with a price target of $95. The firm cites a combination of factors for the upgrade, specifically its strategic acquisition of Goodrich (GR -0.3%) and greater potential earnings power.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • TENX

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT) drops 5.6% after the firm's audit committee discloses ex-Chairman...

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT) drops 5.6% after the firm's audit committee discloses ex-Chairman & CEO Chris Stern was fired for falsifying his resume, and using his position to effect a transaction that netted him $489K in stock warrants. Oxygen announced Stern's dismassal last month, but didn't provide further details.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX +9%) spikes to the top of the S&P leader board after it sells a $193M...

    Consol Energy (CNX +9%) spikes to the top of the S&P leader board after it sells a $193M stake in its Marcellus Shale holdings to Antero Resources Appalachian Corp. Consol will retain existing shallow wells and all other leasehold interests on the acreage, including geological formations generally above and below the Marcellus Shale. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ALKS

    Alkermes (ALKS +2.4%) holds on to gains late in the day after Jefferies raised the shares to...

    Alkermes (ALKS +2.4%) holds on to gains late in the day after Jefferies raised the shares to buy. The firm says the company's merger with Elan Drug Technologies is "under-appreciated."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +5.8%) shares are upgraded at Citigroup, which says the quality of...

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +5.8%) shares are upgraded at Citigroup, which says the quality of OXY's project lineup will differentiate it from others that have simply benefited from higher oil and gas prices. Citi expects OXY to generate $1B-plus in free cash flow, grow production ~10%, and achieve the highest per unit margins among integrated oil companies it covers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • BIG

    Big Lots (BIG +3.6%) rises after Barclays reiterates an Overweight on the seller of closeout and...

    Big Lots (BIG +3.6%) rises after Barclays reiterates an Overweight on the seller of closeout and overstock merchandise, following a meeting with management. Barclays notes management's confidence about its Q4 seasonal/gift merchandise offerings, as well as comments about an inventory refresh for its home category. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +1.8%) gains on an upgrade to add at Capital One on valuation, citing an...

    EOG Resources (EOG +1.8%) gains on an upgrade to add at Capital One on valuation, citing an improving return on capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • MMM

    Shares of Ceradyne (CRDN) soar 12.9% on heavy volume after Benchmark says it sees "compelling"...

    Shares of Ceradyne (CRDN) soar 12.9% on heavy volume after Benchmark says it sees "compelling" valuation after the firm landed a $127M contract from the U.S. military, and now expects improved guidance from the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM

  • After an overnight collapse that saw its price fall about 13% (on top of last week's near 30%...

    After an overnight collapse that saw its price fall about 13% (on top of last week's near 30% dive), silver returns back to unchanged. Gold and copper see similar price action, but not as wild as silver's. With this sort of volatility, another margin hike on top of Friday's is not out of the question.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • ASIA

    Chinese telecom software firm AsiaInfo-Linkage (NASDAQ:ASIA) gains 5% after J.P. Morgan lifts...

    Chinese telecom software firm AsiaInfo-Linkage (NASDAQ:ASIA) gains 5% after J.P. Morgan lifts its PT to $26, while reiterating an Overweight. The firm touts AsiaInfo's low valuation and "defensive growth profile," and recommends shares to both long-term and momentum investors. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +1.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade to outperform at BMO Capital, citing...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +1.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade to outperform at BMO Capital, citing what appears to be a recovery in the company's end markets plus attractive geographic exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM

  • Herman Miller (MHLR +1.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade on valuation by Raymond James to strong...

    Herman Miller (MHLR +1.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade on valuation by Raymond James to strong buy with a price target of $30, citing improving fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • SLS

    RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII -26%) tanks after announcing it plans to split into two publicly...

    RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII -26%) tanks after announcing it plans to split into two publicly traded companies later this year, separating its oncology and gene therapy businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC -21.3%) goes into freefall after DealReporter claims buyout offers for the...

    InterDigital (IDCC -21.3%) goes into freefall after DealReporter claims buyout offers for the 3G/4G patent holder, which put itself on sale in July, have been in the $1B-$2B range. InterDigital's market cap was north of $2.5B heading into today's trading, as hopes ran high of a sale price comparable to that for Nortel's patent portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • RLD

    Shares of RealD (NYSE:RLD) move 3.7% higher after Disney's (DIS +0.5%) reissued hit The Lion...

    Shares of RealD (NYSE:RLD) move 3.7% higher after Disney's (DIS +0.5%) reissued hit The Lion King breathes some new life into the 3-D movie market the company outfits. Count James Cameron - whose movie Avatar grossed a cool $2.8B - as bullish on the future of 3-D. "Once broadcast moves aggressively to 3-D, every movie will be in 3-D. It’s that simple."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • SHW

    Shares of Sherwin-Williams (SHW +5.8%) register a sold gain, helped in part by landing a deal to...

    Shares of Sherwin-Williams (SHW +5.8%) register a sold gain, helped in part by landing a deal to supply paints and coatings at Choice Hotels' large line of hotels and motels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • CMG

    BMO Capital's Phillip Juhan sees a revenue boost for Chipotle (CMG -0.2%) from its new Asian...

    BMO Capital's Phillip Juhan sees a revenue boost for Chipotle (CMG -0.2%) from its new Asian restaurant concept if it expands beyond its initial store in Washington, D.C. The analyst keeps a Market Perform rating in place for now, noting investors have already bid up the share price 50% this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Select casino stocks (BJK -1.9%) see a wave of momentum selling on high volume, as concerns in...

    Select casino stocks (BJK -1.9%) see a wave of momentum selling on high volume, as concerns in the sector focus on high debt, consumers' discretionary spending, and sustained revenue growth in Macau. Decliners: WYNN -5.3%, MPEL -6.7%, CNTY -6.4%, LVS -4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • BAXS

    TranS1 (TSON +6.5%) is trading higher today after closing out its previously announced secondary...

    TranS1 (TSON +6.5%) is trading higher today after closing out its previously announced secondary offering of 6.2M shares and pricing it at $3.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • AMSC

    After surging on Friday on earnings and new contracts, American Superconductor (AMSC -11.6%) is...

    After surging on Friday on earnings and new contracts, American Superconductor (AMSC -11.6%) is selling off sharply. However, the company can claim a legal victory today: an ex-employee accused of stealing the company's technology has been sentenced by an Austrian court, bolstering its legal case against ex-customer Sinovel.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNM

    PNM Resources (PNM +3%) trades higher after Wells Fargo raises the stock to outperform, citing...

    PNM Resources (PNM +3%) trades higher after Wells Fargo raises the stock to outperform, citing the company's recapitalization of its business and a windfall from the expected sale of its power marketing operations. Separately, SunTrust also ups the shares to buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -9.2%) continues its descent that began last week when JPMorgan downgraded shares...

    Molycorp (MCP -9.2%) continues its descent that began last week when JPMorgan downgraded shares and cut its price target to $66 from $105. Some analysts find it hard to imagine rare earth prices coming down much further with such tight supply, barring a collapse of the global economy wiping out demand, but investors appear skeptical.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • BRK.A

    Warren Buffett's negative stance on buybacks comes from his distaste of managers buying high to...

    Warren Buffett's negative stance on buybacks comes from his distaste of managers buying high to offset the dilutive effect of stock options. However (he wrote in 1984), "(If) shares are selling far below intrinsic value ... no alternative action can benefit shareholders as surely as repurchases." Bottom line, says Cullen Roche: Buffett believes BRK.A is cheap, and the rest of the market not so.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +5.9%) is trading higher today following its announcement over the...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +5.9%) is trading higher today following its announcement over the weekend that data from a Phase 3 trial of its chemosaturation system showed extended survival rates for patients with melanoma metastases in the liver. The company also says that separate data from a Phase 2 tests of the same system in a different application showed positive results as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • BA

    Boeing's (BA +2.7%) long-awaited delivery of the 787 Dreamliner lifts the shares of companies...

    Boeing's (BA +2.7%) long-awaited delivery of the 787 Dreamliner lifts the shares of companies that provide materials and parts for the aircraft, as the potential for bigger profits down the road starts to look more realistic. Gainers: HXL +4.5%, CYT +2.5%, SPR +1.6%, ATI +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +1.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to buy at Longbow on...

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +1.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to buy at Longbow on expectations for an improvement in highway stimulus spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • FHN

    First Horizon National (FHN +6%) pops on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to overweight, Morgan says the...

    First Horizon National (FHN +6%) pops on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to overweight, Morgan says the company's exposure to private mortgages is manageable and with expense improvements, better capital management and relatively stable net interest margin give a boost to earnings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • LULU

    Momentum "all-star" Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) moves on some real news today, dropping 3.5% after...

    Momentum "all-star" Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) moves on some real news today, dropping 3.5% after the retailer said it won't be able to keep up a 28% operating margin due to investments to build new stores in North America.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor Holdings (FSL -1.1%) ticks lower after cutting its sales outlook for Q3...

    Freescale Semiconductor Holdings (FSL -1.1%) ticks lower after cutting its sales outlook for Q3 due to weakness in its industrial and networking businesses. The warning is just the latest sign of weakness in the semiconductor space and follows similar guidance cuts from Altera (ALTR -1.2%) and Xilinx (XLNX -0.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -8.5%) is adding to last week's losses with another sharp move lower. In addition to...

    Sina (SINA -8.5%) is adding to last week's losses with another sharp move lower. In addition to ongoing regulatory fears, shares could be affected by news of Tencent's (OTCPK:TCEHY) rival microblogging service beating Sina's service to the punch in offering English-language support. SINA has now fallen 30% since its Sep. 14 close.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • AAPL

    U.S. shares are higher across the board, with the Nasdaq - off 1.7% earlier - joining the...

    U.S. shares are higher across the board, with the Nasdaq - off 1.7% earlier - joining the S&P and DJIA in the green. DJIA +1.6%, S&P 500 +1.3%, Nasdaq +0.6%.  Down sharply early on a report of lower iPad orders, Apple (AAPL -0.6%) is threatening to turn positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • JBLU

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +4.1%) lead a pack of airline stocks higher after the price of oil tails...

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +4.1%) lead a pack of airline stocks higher after the price of oil tails off again. Crude oil futures fell below $79 a barrel for November delivery, marking its lowest level since early August. Carriers on the rise after the move: AMR +2.7%, UAL +3.2%, SKYW +3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +5.8%) trades up after saying Russian investment firm Rusnano will spend...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +5.8%) trades up after saying Russian investment firm Rusnano will spend up to $26M over the next four years to help fund a new company unit that will develop a portfolio of new preclinical drug candidates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • OMEX

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (OMEX +9.8%) confirms it's located the SS Gairsoppa, a 412-foot...

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (OMEX +9.8%) confirms it's located the SS Gairsoppa, a 412-foot British ship that was carrying 7M ounces of silver when it was torpedoed and sunk in 1941. Under a 2010 salvage agreement with the British government, Odyssey will keep 80% of the cargo. Not a bad haul, with silver trading around $30/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) drops 11% following comments from Mongolia's Energy Minister suggesting the...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN) drops 11% following comments from Mongolia's Energy Minister suggesting the Mongolian government wants to up its stake in Ivanhoe's Oyu Tolgoi copper and gold mine to 50% from 34%. Ivanhoe has issued a statement expecting the current agreement to be respected, but the market has its doubts. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • FCFS

    First Cash Financial Services (FCFS -6.5%) trades lower this morning after Stern Agee cut the...

    First Cash Financial Services (FCFS -6.5%) trades lower this morning after Stern Agee cut the shares to neutral on valuation, saying the stock is trading at a premium to its "blended" PE, whereas most specialty finance stocks sell at a discount.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • JJT-OLD

    Tin (JJT-OLD +4.5%) prices move higher after Indonesia - the world's largest producer - halts...

    Tin (JJT-OLD +4.5%) prices move higher after Indonesia - the world's largest producer - halts exports of the metal due to a sharp decline in prices. Leaders are still meeting to determine how long the country will keep the measure in place.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • CALM

    Cal-Maine Foods (CALM -1.3%)) FQ1 beat on revenues but missed EPS estimates as higher feed costs...

    Cal-Maine Foods (CALM -1.3%)) FQ1 beat on revenues but missed EPS estimates as higher feed costs dug into margins. The company also notes that feed costs are likely to remain very high and volatile for the year ahead as well. Separately, its Founder and Chairman Fred Adams Jr. suffered a mild stroke while attending an industry event on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • SWY

    Shares of Safeway (NYSE:SWY) clock a 5.6% gain after Longbow Research backs off its Sell rating...

    Shares of Safeway (NYSE:SWY) clock a 5.6% gain after Longbow Research backs off its Sell rating and moves to a Neutral call on valuation. Perhaps lifted by Safeway's reversal, mid-sized grocery chains The Fresh Market (TFM +5.1%) and Arden Group (ARDNA +3.7%) are also getting a second look from investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +1.2%) is trading higher this morning after the FDA put its stamp of...

    Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +1.2%) is trading higher this morning after the FDA put its stamp of approval over the weekend for using company's blockbuster drug Remicade on pediatric patients with ulcerative colitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AAPL

    Many of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) key chip suppliers are underperforming following J.P. Morgan's...

    Many of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) key chip suppliers are underperforming following J.P. Morgan's iPad report. BRCM -2.5%. QCOM -1.2%. TSM -3.1%. SWKS -4.1%. TQNT -1.7%. OVTI -2.2%. CRUS -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AAPL

    As Apple (AAPL -3.1%) takes the NASDAQ lower following a report of an iPad order cut, Joshua...

    As Apple (AAPL -3.1%) takes the NASDAQ lower following a report of an iPad order cut, Joshua Brown thinks the news translates into a near-term "power play" for bears, given how tech stocks in general, and Apple in particular, have been outperforming. Of course, it still remains up for debate just how much of the cut is the result of weakening demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • GNRC

    Generac Holdings (GNRC +10.5%) pops after the firm provides updated guidance for H2 indicating...

    Generac Holdings (GNRC +10.5%) pops after the firm provides updated guidance for H2 indicating recent power outages in the Midwest and East Coast boosted demand for its generators. The firm forecasts residential product sales in Q4 will increase by 15%-20% (Y/Y), and says a residual effect from consumers' heightened awareness of outages could be felt for 12 to 18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM

  • Some red poking out in Europe, which is on the verge of giving up all of its 4% gains from just...

    Some red poking out in Europe, which is on the verge of giving up all of its 4% gains from just a couple of hours ago.. Stoxx 50 +0.5%, France -0.1%, U.K. -0.4%, Germany +0.7%. The euro gives up its gains as well, -0.5% to $1.3425.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • M

    Macy's (M +1.8%) says it plans to increase holiday hiring by 4%, turning analysts' forecast for...

    Macy's (M +1.8%) says it plans to increase holiday hiring by 4%, turning analysts' forecast for sluggish seasonal hiring on its head. Most of the positions are only part-time, but the move has helped lift slouching sentiment in the retail sector. Gainers: JCP +2.2%, DDS 1.5%, SSI +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +6.3%) gains after the company announces positive results for a clinical trial...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +6.3%) gains after the company announces positive results for a clinical trial of Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) T-DM1 breast cancer drug, for which ImmunoGen is in line to collect royalties. Canaccord is reiterating a Buy and $14 PT in response.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • ABVT

    Shares of AboveNet (ABVT +5.5%) get a lift from Raymond James with an upgrade to Strong Buy from...

    Shares of AboveNet (ABVT +5.5%) get a lift from Raymond James with an upgrade to Strong Buy from Outperform. The company looks to benefit from the cloud market indirectly with a new agreement with Amazon (AMZN +2.1%) allowing customers to circumvent the internet and connect directly to Amazon's data centers via its fiber optic network.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • ARIA

    Shares of Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +2.9%) move higher after the firm announces long-term...

    Shares of Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +2.9%) move higher after the firm announces long-term results of a Phase 1 trial of its leukemia treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • AAPL

    As Apple (AAPL -2.3%) drops following J.P. Morgan's report of a major cut in Q4 iPad orders for...

    As Apple (AAPL -2.3%) drops following J.P. Morgan's report of a major cut in Q4 iPad orders for Asian suppliers, Steve Kovach suggests the move could simply be the result of Apple shifting some of its manufacturing to Brazil. It was reported earlier this month a Brazilian plant partly owned by Foxconn is ready to begin iPad production.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) announces a share repurchase program, planning to reduce its...

    Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) announces a share repurchase program, planning to reduce its cash holdings to no less than $20B. The company will pay no price higher than a 10% premium over the then-current book value of the shares. BRK.B +4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 4% premarket following its deal with DWA. Shares are also getting a...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 4% premarket following its deal with DWA. Shares are also getting a boost from an upgrade to Buy from Merriman's Eric Wold. Wold thinks Netflix's near-term problems are "more than reflected" in its valuation, now that shares have fallen 55% since his July 6 downgrade, and he's still bullish on the company's positioning and long-term potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 3 Comments
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences (MELA) +83% premarket after the FDA issues an "approvable letter" for its medical...

    Mela Sciences (MELA) +83% premarket after the FDA issues an "approvable letter" for its medical device that aims to help doctors more accurately diagnose melanoma. Previously the agency had called on the company to conduct a large new study of the MelaFind device, which already is approved for use in 27 European countries.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AMD

    AMD is up 3.7% premarket after UBS' Uche Orji upgrades the chipmaker to Buy and lifts his PT to...

    AMD is up 3.7% premarket after UBS' Uche Orji upgrades the chipmaker to Buy and lifts his PT to $9. Orji notes his Asian checks show strong desktop PC demand, and he's optimistic on both AMD's upcoming CPU products, and new CEO Rory Read's ability to improve the company's "go-to-market execution."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • SSKN

    Premarket gainers: MELA +109%. OMEX +13%. CTIC +7%. DB +7%. ING +7%. BCS +6%. DANG +6%. LYG +5%....

    Premarket gainers: MELA +109%. OMEX +13%. CTIC +7%. DB +7%. ING +7%. BCS +6%. DANG +6%. LYG +5%. AEG +4%. NFLX +4%. PT-OLD +4%. AMD +4%. NOK +4%. CS +4%. CCL +3%. YRCW +3%. ALU +3%. MT +3%. TOT +3%. AKS +3%. IHG +3%. X +3%.
    Losers: EK -17%. CLX -6%. SPIL -3%. SLW -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) captures the attention of analysts with Canaccord...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) captures the attention of analysts with Canaccord Genuity reiterating its Buy rating and $120 PT, while Argus initiates coverage with a Buy tag and a lofty $130 PT. Shares of GMCRhave gone on a 6-month tear, up 66%, and are tacking on 0.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) looks poised for a higher open, after Maxim Group upgrades shares to...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) looks poised for a higher open, after Maxim Group upgrades shares to Hold from Sell as a value play and Lazard Capital says the stock's recent selloff is overdone. Lazard expects First Solar to close on the two remaining Department of Energy loan projects and to find buyers for all three projects. FSLR +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • GXP

    Goldman weighs in on the utility sector again, adding Great Plains Energy (NYSE:GXP) to its...

    Goldman weighs in on the utility sector again, adding Great Plains Energy (NYSE:GXP) to its Conviction Buy list. The firm slated in a price target of $21 for Great Plains Energy on its potential for 2013 after it outlives a rate case and delays in coal shipments. Shares of GXP +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • AEO

    Chairman Jay Schottenstein purchased 1M shares of American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) last week...

    Chairman Jay Schottenstein purchased 1M shares of American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) last week for ~$11.2M, and Director Michael Jesselson purchased ~120,000 shares of the teen retailer, according to SEC filings. Shares +5.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • ESLT

    Shares of Israeli defense firm Elbit Systems (NASDAQ:ESLT) get a 6% bounce premarket after the...

    Shares of Israeli defense firm Elbit Systems (NASDAQ:ESLT) get a 6% bounce premarket after the company announces it will repurchase 1M shares over the next 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • KODK

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) fall 14% premarket after the firm announces it borrowed $160M...

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) fall 14% premarket after the firm announces it borrowed $160M against its credit line for "general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • SCGLY

    It's the beaten down bank shares partying hardest in Europe. SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) leads the...

    It's the beaten down bank shares partying hardest in Europe. SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) leads the French lenders, +8%. In Milan, Intesa Sanpaolo +10.1%. Germany's Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) +8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 2 Comments

  • European shares leg up to new highs for the session. The Stoxx 50 +4.4%, Germany +4.1%, Italy...

    European shares leg up to new highs for the session. The Stoxx 50 +4.4%, Germany +4.1%, Italy +4.7%.
